I,. . urn. ,.....SECRET.C A B IN E T*TEH IS OF AGREE; ?E;-*T ARRAHGI;') ON SATURDAY NIGHT 9th APRIL, 1921, BETV,EBN THE GOVERNMENT AND REPRESENTATIVES Or THE RAILEAYrtEN AND TRANSPORTWORKERS.It has been agreed that (1) The Government shall summon a conference of the representatives of the -liners'' Federation and the Coal-Owners to meet at the Board of Trade on Monday, April 11th, at 11 a.m, to discuss all questions in dispute between the parties.(2) The liners1 Federation shall tonight issue notices to the Brandies of the Federation urging their members to abstain from all action which will interfere with the measures necessary for securing the safety of the mines or will necessitate the use of force by the Government,2, Whitehall Gardens,, S.v,'*l., April 9th, 1921.
